channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Witness’s Account of Charlie Kirk Shooting: ‘People Got Down in Waves’
item.description: Andrew Piskadlo, who estimated that he was about 80 feet away when the shooting happened, said the crack of the shot was not heard by all.

item.title: Wearable sales are flat but ring sales are up 100%, says Oura CEO
item.description: Oura's sensor rings are especially popular with women, who appreciate its Advisor tool and female-focused features.

item.title: Mamdani Reflects on Life After 9/11 as a Muslim in New York City
item.description: Ahead of the 24th anniversary of Sept. 11, Zohran Mamdani, the front-runner to be the city’s next mayor, spoke about the importance of honoring the vi...

item.title: Trump, Modi agree to talk in bid to resolve trade impasse
item.description: “I am confident that our trade negotiations will pave the way for unlocking the limitless potential of the India-U.S. partnership,” Modi said.

item.title: Klarna made a solid debut on the New York Stock Exchange with shares up 15% in first day of trading
item.description: Klarna just made its debut as the biggest IPO this year. The Swedish buy-now-pay-later giant sees America as its future—and it's taking direct aim at ...

item.title: Trump: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk has died after being shot at a Utah college event
item.description: The co-founder and CEO of the youth organization Turning Point USA, the 31-year-old Kirk is the latest victim in a spasm of political violence across ...

item.title: Charlie Kirk, Right-Wing Provocateur and Close Ally of Trump, Dies at 31
item.description: The founder of Turning Point USA played a central role in organizing young voters and giving shape to the pro-Trump agenda. He was fatally shot during...

item.title: Inspector General to review ‘the challenges that Bureau of Labor Statistics encounters’ collecting economic data
item.description: The audit will focus on the agency's reports on inflation and employment, a Wednesday letter to BLS acting commissioner William Wiatrowski said.

item.title: Prince Harry Reunites With King Charles for First Time in Over a Year
item.description: Father and son had tea at the king’s London residence on Wednesday, in what may be a first step toward healing a painful rift that has divided Britain...

item.title: How Macron Failed to Curb the Far Right
item.description: As France drifted to the right, the president has tried to make the country more business-friendly and win back voters. His strategy hasn’t worked.

item.title: France Braces for Protests
item.description: Protesters blocked roads, roundabouts and tram lines across the country as Sébastien Lecornu took office. It was a sign of the challenges ahead.

item.title: 3 Students Shot and Critically Injured at Colorado High School, Authorities Say
item.description: The attack took place on the campus of Evergreen High School in Evergreen, Colo., which is southwest of Denver, according to the local sheriff’s offic...

item.title: Facing Israeli Assault, Many in Gaza City Say Fleeing Again Is Worse

item.title: Many Palestinians Leave Gaza City After Evacuation Order
